edu.smith.cs.csc262.coopsh

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.smith.cs.csc262.coopsh.Task
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Cat, ConsolePrinter, Echo, Head, Pwd, SimpleGrep, WordCount

    public abstract class Task
extends Object
    Cooperative Task abstract class. Each Task may send output to another outputTask and it buffers input in input.
    Author:
    jfoley

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected String[] args
      Command line arguments.
      protected ShellEnvironment env
      For getting the current directory, variables, etc.
      Integer exitCode
      This is how we know whether a task has finished.
      protected LinkedList<InputLine> input
      The input it has received (a task may ignore!).
      protected Task outputTask
      The task it is talking to, or maybe null.
      static int TOO_MUCH_TIME
      Unless you're working with really big files, this should be enough.

    • Method Detail

      • exit

        public void exit(int x)
        On UNIX systems, a nonzero exit code indicates failure. Make sure all your "Tasks" call exit(0) or exit(-1) as appropriate.
        Parameters:
        x - - the exit code.

      • isDone

        Is this Task complete?
        Returns:

        e - - where did it happen?

      • closeOutput

        public void closeOutput()
        When done with updates, we call "closeOutput". We prevent it from being called multiple times.

      • update

        protected abstract void update()
        Do a bite-size piece of work. DO NOT BLOCK.

        Connect the output of this task to the input of the next.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the task you've passed in.

      • collectTasks

        public List<Task> collectTasks()
        Starting at the "front" task, collect them into a list.
        Returns:
        a list of Task objects.
